meanings.definition: The act of attaching something again.
meanings.sent1: The reattachment of the broken handle was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the reattachment of the fallen branches was necessary.
meanings.sent3: The reattachment of the lost button made the coat whole again.
meanings.sent4: Her reattachment to her childhood home was like finding a piece of herself.
meanings.sent5: The reattachment of the puzzle pieces completed the picture perfectly.

meanings.definition: The process of reconnecting or rejoining something that was previously separated.
meanings.sent1: The reattachment of the train cars was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The reattachment of the internet connection fixed the communication issue.
meanings.sent3: The reattachment of the friendship after the argument brought relief to both.
meanings.sent4: The reattachment of the torn paper symbolized reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The reattachment of the broken necklace brought back memories of happier times.
